reviews.review_msg: If you are in business, do yourself a favour and take BUS 232. Brutal exams and this course takes away your will to live (I promise). Listen to the comments and DO NOT take this course with Schwartz, maybe someone else? but DEFINITELY in person never online, ever.
Guys, if you don't know how to integrate then you definitely shouldn't take this course.. there's double integration
should've listened to the comments

Prof Swartz makes students buy his own textbook (which is actually the worst textbook I've ever had to read) in order to complete assignments(20%). He also doesn't post any lec vids, he posts 2-3 vids that solve the most basic questions you'll encounter. Two exams worth 40% each. His midterm was crazy hard and he doesn't allow qs during testing....

Online class not graded on much. Mt1 was fairish but included content we hadn't learned (marks given back, but time wasted). No "real" online lessons, videos show 1 question each. INCREDIBLY difficult final meant to spread out the class' percentages. Dude is shady asf, no avg released but I suspect it was around 20%, I got 63% and got an A+ LOOOOL.

He's getting paid just to repost his old videos from covid classes and to sell copies of his textbook. He does not care and does nothing to help students. He is lazy and this course is just a source of passive income for him.
I want to kms

Online lectures are 10 minute example problems without context, you have to read the textbook, which assumes you already know the content he's supposed to teach. Final was unfair: tedious work like calculating the mean and stddev of 40 data points before using them in a formula. Means are easy, just give us them so we can finish the problem.
I never considered suicide until taking his course

Online "lectures" are just 5 - 10 minute example problems with no proper explanation of what we are actually learning. You will need to learn everything from the textbook that he wrote. Unfortunately, the textbook is just his plagiarized notes. For actual learning, I recommend reading Devore's textbook. You will need to be fully self-taught.

didn't have him as a professor, but was forced to use his textbook (there's a 3-page pdf online that lists all the errors in book, most of them numerical errors in examples given) his textbook sucks (confusing and unprofessional explanations) and the only practice midterms he provides are handwritten with spelling mistakes
He is nice but the midterms are really not easy. Formula sheet is allowed in the final. Some problems in final just the same as that in midterm.

I don't know if he recently lowered the difficulty level of the quizzes but i find them extremely easy and predictable. I have scored 12/12 on all three quizzes so far and he is very humourous which makes his lectures very enjoyable. Nice professor overall.

Good prof overall, very nice, very helpful, his weakness is testing, Way too hard. For all 4 quizzes average was always around 30-40% (stat 270), Even though hes a nice guy, I wouldn't take him again, because the testing is just a pain in the ass.

A great prof, and the mini-tests are more helpful than assignments. Not worth too much, but keeps you on track. Going to lectures definitely helps, but you must be attentive. His minitests are also very predictable, as he gives us hints in class.
No Comments
Can't teach.

Jorge definitely does not know how to teach. During lecture, he uses phrases like "I think..." "... I guess" when explaining because he copies the notes. When a student asks a question, I believe most of the time he confuses the students more than they were. A lot of equations are expected to be memorized for the exam. Avoid him if you can.

I agree that the lectures are confusing :s I don't get much out of class. I pretty much just learn from the textbook and try to do lots of the questions. The workshop TAs are usually helpful and a couple are pretty cute too :)  If possible I would recommend taking this class with a different prof.
Unable to teach things in class. Usually makes things more complicated and harder to understand the material. Worst prof ever had.1
During his lecture, he was basically just giving equations then the answer. He cannot explain anything.

I'm just wondering if he has ever come here to read student feedback for him. I have never rated any professor but today i have to because hes that bad. His first midterm exam was so confusing, time consuming... Didnt give many exercises. I did all the exercises in textbook but the exam was totally different. Too much calculating
AWFUL.TERRIBLE.
Run

She responded well to questions during the lecture and gave good answers to all of my questions after the lecture.  A bit fast with the material during lecture though.  A big plus is that she gives away test and exam questions during her lecture-time examples and gave me my score on the final exam as my grade for the course.

It was hard to get used to her style of teaching at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's all smooth sailing. Sometimes she may go a bit quick and be unclear, but she'll be more than happy to answer your questions and clarify. It was a learning experience for her as this was her first time teaching the course. Exams were very fair!

Horrible prof, first week is okay because everything is common sense. Then it goes down hill from there. She makes NO sense at all. Does examples and doesn't even tell you what the question was. You have to depend on the text book, but guess what? the text book sucks too! your screwed. Dont take it, run away!

I don't know what other people are saying. Her assignments are super long, but there are only three of them. Midterms were fair game. She is very helpful in office hours. She encourages questions during lectures and the lectures are super informative. Overall, very helpful and nice prof. Thank you for a great course. Super Hot Prof!

Horrible teaching skill. Worse teacher ever. She dose do care if you understand the topic or not. And does not care if you can learn any thing. She will not give you any time to copy her note. Can you believe she can teach you nothing from the first lecture till the end? Try that youself!
STAT 270 is not hard, but the way she teach can really confuse u. if u choose her class, u have to study hard by urself and wish god bless u~!
worst prof ever dot

She doens't know how to teach. If you have any questions to ask her, she'll refer your to tim swartz website. she just keep going on and on and doesn't care whether you understand the materials or not. if you have to take this course i highly recommmended not to!

Omg she cannot even give an example on her own. Seems does not prepare the class at all. Does not know what she is going to talk. She does not care about the students. Just talk and talk and go to the book and keep talking. When we say we cannot hear her, she just shake her head a bit and go on.  Worst prof ever.
Take Lloyd if you want a chill STAT 270 experience: a rare feat compared to what you hear from most 270 profs.

Contrary to what many would say, I thought his lectures were extremely good. Boring for sure, but effective. Covered all the fundamentals and key examples, was accessible with office hours, and curved very generously even though the averages were already high

Lloyd was in the weird spot of being both an awful and GOATED prof. His lectures weren't all that good and his quizzes absolutely sucked in the beginning, but towards the end he became way fairer and he also curved the average to a B+ which is fairly high. I have mixed feelings, but I think he has potential to be a good prof
I'll admit, I didn't like him at all at first. But I gave him another chance after a terrible first half, and oh boy he improved a lot. I think he saw the old reviews lol
His final exam was very fair. It was challenging enough to test if we can apply course concepts, but not too challenging to the point of unfairness

His slides are more than enough to study. Honestly, you don't even need to attend the lectures, though I would suggest you do, as he gives lots of insights and tips for the questions that appear on the slides.
If you can do basic polynomial integrals, this class will be a breeze

Truly an interesting arc: started with high ratings, then his ratings tanked over some salty students, then revived after he curved up to a B+ average. Just goes to show that the reviews are an easiness rating rather than a teaching rating
If you have the opportunity, take a stats course with this guy. Definitely one of my favorite professors

The old reviews are hilarious. Some of y'all think a 60% average is low 💀 
But yeah he's an amazing prof and quizzes aren't hard. Many people just don't study and the curve gets lowered

4 quizzes and a final making the entire grade sounds scary until you see how trivial the questions are. You're given a full 50 mins for the quizzes, but trust me when I say that you can finish in like 15. It's that easy

He looked out for all our GPAs. In fall 2024 the grades took awfully long to come back but that turned out to be cuz the dept took a while to approve his B+ average for us
He curved like crazy, showing that he ultimately cared for our success

Some of these 1 star reviews are from whiny first years who look for ways to cope rather than assessing their own shortcomings. Lloyd is an amazing professor who clearly knows his stuff. Those who dunk on him over small mistakes during lectures don't realize that he's human lol
This man single handedly had one of the biggest professor redemptions I've seen in a long minute
The old slander for him was acc crazy. Tests were super ez but people will find stuff to complain about no matter what. If you actually study, there's nothing hard about the course.

This class is very straightforward. The textbook guides you with lots of problems, so just practice a lot. Lloyd was extremely kind and approachable, and I personally enjoyed his teaching style. His exams were also more than fair and reflected the class content. Definitely a good choice for STAT270 if you don't want to work much outside of class

Honestly, one of the better if not best STAT 270 profs in the department, and it's only his first time teaching which says a lot. He was very helpful and super fair on the exams - lectures and lecture slides were more than enough to study. Only cons are that lectures were boring and he stuttered a bit - but overall, if you need 270, take Lloyd!

lectures were just slides and he wrote on the chalkboard, not recorded however he pretty much followed the textbook so if you read it and do the given examples, you should be able to do well. last 2 midterms and final (mc, short answer, written) were fair, not too difficult not too easy. he turned the semester around for the better

For his first time teaching stat270 he didn't do bad at all. The class was marked on 4 midterms and a final worth 40% (the lowest midterm dropped). He's super caring and genuinely wants to improve, but just learning the ropes. First 2 midterms were like a test run, but the last 2 and the final were much better suited towards the course content.

Lloyd was a great prof, it's just that STAT 270 is a hard course. But he didn't make it harder than it needed to be, his quizzes were more than fair if you studied, especially the latter 2 of the 4. His lectures improved drastically throughout the semester, so although he started out rough, I'd say he's great overall. Much better than Swartz!
Veryyyy Garbage
Stutters a lot and explanations are meh, but the quizzes are very straightforward with the most recent quiz having a 78% average. Nice guy.

This prof does not have the proper social skills to be a teacher. He is unable to stand in front of our class and give a lecture without buffering every other sentence. The textbook is very unhelpful so you can't rely on him or the textbook. He is a very kind and caring prof but unfortunately he is failing us as a teacher.
Very caring and kind professor! His passion for the subject is contagious.

The best way I can describe his teaching is that it's as if he's seeing the slides for the first time and had to pretend he knows whats going on. Exams questions are nothing like ANY of the practice problems, textbook for self learning doesnt help, it just throws symbols without explaning. Oh and he thought ln(0)=1 which is crazy.

Very kind and caring professor. His lectures can be quite boring and he does sometimes ramble, but it has gotten better. His quizzes are quite fair, but people got caught off guard a bit because it didn't really match the assignments (one of the cons). Otherwise, he's willing to help you out during office hours.
He is actually a really good professor and doing his best, his exams are easy if you put in the effort. Do not trust the ratings of first year babies that want easy A's .

I get the sense that Dr. Elliott would be far more well-liked if he was more prepared for lectures and gave better examples in class, as he does seem passionate. However, I found that his lectures weren't helpful at all for assignments/exams and I often relied on the book. He's willing to help outside of class, so that's one silver lining.

every time i go to lecture i can feel my braincells dying. i can tell the prof cares about the content deeply but the way he goes about teaching is just not very effective. stutters every other sentence and doesnt seem confident at all, sometimes barely finding and fixing mistakes on slides during class. be prepared to self study!

Dr Lloyd Lloyd Elliot is truly one of the professors of all time. His lectures are like watching a sitcom. He drops his chalk, reboots like a robot, and asks questions to the class and the whole class remains silent. He explains some content like his life depends on it, and others like it's arbitrary, it's truly an artistic method of lecturing.
his exam is awful.

be ready to fight a war in this class. He is not the best at teaching but a very nice and knowledgeable man. Lectures are very hard to sit through as we're usually stuck on one or two slides the whole class on the easy stuff then we're breezing through the hardest subjects. Really wishing sfu payed some attention to these issues.
As a stat major, he's the worst at explaining and teaching compare to my other stat prof
Nice prof, but his test has nothing to do with that he teaches. He makes an intro statistic course very hard to understand
he doesn't go over any example in class, make sure to learn everything by yourself.

Very nice prof, but unfortunately gives the worst lectures I have had by a significant margin. He stutters quite a bit, will pause for 20-30 seconds sometimes, and has to go back to correct himself very often. Rarely does worked examples in class, and when he does, they are explained poorly. Sample quizzes are also nothing like the actual quizzes

Nice person, but not a great lecturer unfortunately. Often stumbles and loses his train of thought, or makes errors during examples. Exams are pretty doable, but lots of self-teaching, as he doesn't give many examples in class. It's unfortunate because he actually seems quite nice, but he's not the best prof for 270.

Hello Mr Llodyd Elliott, you are making my life a living nightmare rn. You teach me nothing, give out no good practice questions, and then give BS quizzes on questions/material that was only covered on surface level. If you are reading this PLEASE DO BETTER. Give proper samples/practice questions u didn't rush to make, and please scale our grades.

Absolutely avoid this class with him if you can. You have to teach yourself EVERYTHING and pray that the quizes are fair. He doesn't teach very well in class so lectures are pretty much useless but the text book will somewhat save you if you actually lock in.
Sample quizzes have nothing to do with actual quizzes. Expect to pay full tuition to teach yourself.
calculate the probability of him getting a question correct...

0 teaching ability for an intro course. Overcomplicated easy concepts with poor explanations, would ramble, waste time, and god forbid he attempted a practice problem cus he was not getting it right. Prac quizzes n textbook problems had 0 similarity to the actual quizzes. Quizzes themselves were alright just expect to learn everything by yourself.
Avoid her at all costs.

NEVER take her class, online sources was very limited, just 2 videos per chapter, the videos only talked 2 sample questions, which was useless. A LOT of formulas to remember and no cheat sheet on the test. The formula sheet she gave on the test was the most basic one, and barely use them.
Course was heavy on self-study but the prof was helpful to answer all my emails and questions. She uses simple languages and explain the materials well. Grading was fair.
I highly recommend NEVER taking her class, ESPECIALLY  if you have accommodations, because she will fight to not accommodate you. Definitely needs a lesson on equity vs equality.
A truly disturbing experience.

Worst experience. She does not put the minimum effort to run the class. Usually reads off from the textbook (which is not what a Prof is supposed to do in the class). Very aggressive toward feedback. I think she herself does not know the material. All reviews you read about her here is CORRECT. She should not be teaching despite her performance.

Tough class because I believe Mrs.Graham is unfamiliar with the technology used post covid. Little to no lecture slides, question forums, ressources or announcements made outside of lectures. Textbook was incredible and her tests are fail, but be prepared to do a lot of youtube scouring and studying on your own time.
Avoid Jinko like the plague

Worst class I've taken at SFU. She never made adjustments to quizzes or exams even though the class would constantly give her feedback and ideas to improve the course. There were no assignments or midterms, all grades were determined from quizzes and 1 final exam. There was no syllabus of recommended textbooks questions or lecture outline.

Probably the worst professor of SFU. More than half of the class was failing the quizzes which were 12% each of the total grade. To justify this she said in class,  you have to live with it. Moreover quizzes were lengthy and tough. Time given for each quiz is horribly low. If you think you GPA is too much take this course with Jinko.

Professor Graham has failed to deliver the course content in my perspective. Lectures in no way helped me to understand the subjects in the course, and learning objectives are often unclear. The textbook is dense and it is the only reliable source of learning along with external sources. Grading from only 6 quizzes and 1 exam is very uninspiring.

Poorly delivered course. 65% of overall grade came from 5 quizzes each 25mins long. All quizzes but 1 had massive issues such as the TA not sending us the required graphs, canvas kicking everyone out, etc. Minimal communication between profs, and wouldnt answer emails until the day before the final. Read word for word from the textbook for lecture.
She just reads the textbook whole lecture. It seems she herself doesnt know any content. They cant distribute time in exams and if you have any issue, it is nearly impossible to get reply from her.

Jesus christ, this is the worst experience I ever had in SFU. STAT 270 of 2020 Fall term is a diaster. Too hard problems of quizzes and elementary level problems of final makes me feel my hard working is insulted after the term. Just wanna remind all of the students who wanna pick Jinko's course, prepare to face hell.

Worst lecture quality of any course I've ever taken. Concepts were poorly explained and didn't cover questions of the same difficulty as tests. There were no assignments over the semester, only quizzes, so no feedback. There were technical issues with every single quiz (I think) and the prof was unhelpful. Just read the textbook instead of lecture.

Absolute nightmare of a prof. Reads off of textbook. quizzes always had some kind of technical issue. tells people to drop the class when they come to her with concerns. As a cherry on top, she straight up stopped responding to e-mails 2 weeks before the final so no one could access her if they had a question. does not care about her job even 1 bit

Grade depended mostly on quizzes, and every single quiz had technical issues that could have been easily fixed if she listened to student suggestions. Instead she was defensive, rude and openly ignored questions she didn't want to answer. No assignments, so we barely knew what to study. Basically didn't even do the bare minimum to teach

utterly incompetent. cannot teach & reads over textbook. we had 6 quizzes all worth 65%. 4/6 quizzes had problems like quiz wasn't sent out on time, quiz was missing 2/8 questions (that were e-mailed to us 5 mins before the end of quiz) and she handled those issues in the worst possible way. do yourself a favor and take this class another semester.
Disrespectful to students and just not a good lecturer.

She doesn't understand how to run an online class. It's impossible to get perfect. Most people seem to fail them. She also has a tendency to blame students for her failures, and she told us on the first day of class that it is impossible, and that if you find the first quiz hard, to simply drop the class.

Her teaching method is called reading a textbook that is so confusing that it really doesn't matter if you attend lecture or not. She can't read chat while teaching so any answers you can get are provided by students. She also doesn't know how to make quizzes and there is always something wrong with them and she blames the students for her mistakes

Jinko is hands down the worst prof I've had in my 3 years of uni. Her lectures consist of her writing on a piece of paper, with handwriting that is barely readable, recorded on a low quality camera. She just reads over the textbook & writes it down. exams are too long. when confronted with a complaint or concern, she suggest you drop the course

The first day she unironically told us the course difficulty was "impossible", and I see why now. It really is impossible to learn from her rambling lectures, finish her quizzes on time, or even bring up concerns with her (see other reviews). I was actually excited for stats going into the year, but she has made me actively hate the subject now.

rediculous grading scheme, every quizs have heavy content to read but only gives you less then 30 minutes to finish, the course itself isn't hard but if the prof teachs nothing but just read the book it's not gonna work, and the video meeting quality of her lecture is just blury.

She's the worst. She doesn't teach anything just reads stuff from textbook. The majority of grade is from quizzes and she keeps changing the format for every single quiz and there are some issues always. She give 8-9 Q while each needs has tons of calculations and only 25 mins.I would say this time is only for 1or2 Q. DON'T TAKE WITH HER!!

Mrs. Graham does not know how to run an online course. Period. Her lectures consist of her pointing her camera down at a piece of scrap paper in a poorly lit room, reading out the textbook verbatim. Quizzes are an absolute nightmare - they make up 65% of your mark, and you have no time to answer correctly (most people I've heard from fail them!)
Avoid. Quizzes extremely difficult given the time constraints. Textbook practice rarely helps on exams. The entire semester was a continuous bruh moment.
Does not "teach" the material and concept, she reads you the book during her online lectures. Nor do we get actual slides to refer to.

This is the worst prof I have ever had. Lectures feel pointless and unorganized. You are not given enough time to complete quizzes and they are worth the majority of you grade. The professor gets defensive when given constructive criticism about the class. Steer clear of this professor for online classes!

Awful professor. Her quizzes are too long for 25 minutes, and they're worth 65% of the class, so it's not like the course is that tough, it's just that she's the worst professor in the world and I don't think she should be teaching anywhere. She gets defensive and tells you to drop the course if you tell her anything. Blacklist this professor.

Sometimes I read bad reviews on ratemyprof and think people are just bitter but when I say she is an awful prof, please believe me. She holds a quiz for feedback and gets angry and defensive when given feedback: "Withdraw from the course then if you don't like it". her lectures are just her reading out of the textbook (literally). Absolutely awful.

Easily the worst prof at SFU. Terrible transition to online teaching and refuses to adapt after pleas from the class. When you raise a concern with her she recommends you drop the course even after the date for a full refund. Lectures are useless. Quizzes way too long for time given considering upload time.
She is the worst prof in my life. pls do NOT take her course.

She is an good lecturer: she can make a rather complex topic very accessible. On the other hand, her tests are a lottery. On one day the exam may be laughably easy, on the other - unbelievably challenging. Oh, and remember to take notes: she tests you on the material that is NOT covered in the book.

Derek took over my STAT 270 class for another professor who was on strike. He is a really, really nice guy, and he comes off as very welcoming/caring. His examples were funny and relatable, and it is very evident that he cares about his students. His slides could be better, but 270 is also a hard class that requires you to put in a lot of effort.

He is a no-nonsense kind of guy. Just show up to lectures and pay attention and you should do okay. If you want to do really well you will need to go to office hours and the stat workshop. This is a difficult course, but Derek can explain things really well. Don't fall behind or you are done.

The course grade relies fully on midterms and the final, but there were practice tests provided. Lectures are structured with some examples but practicing the problems related to the lectures will be your best bet.
Exams are rather difficult and this course is not curved at all. There are no assignments to help boost the grades. If you messed up the midterms you will probably end up with a C- or lower

Derek is a professor that actually cares about his students, and wants everyone to do well. To do well just practice his practice midterms, and assignments as his tests are commonly copy and pasted from here. Overall a great teacher!
Derek is a great prof for STAT 270. Fair exams and great lecturer, would highly recommend him over the other STAT 270 profs.

Derek definitely knows the material he's teaching, and is able to explain it in a way that is understandable (for the most part). His tests are very fair in terms of asking questions on exactly what he said would be there, and doesn't add any trick questions. He also tries to minimize the calculus exposure whenever possible, which is great!

Derek is overall a nice prof, he goes throught his notes and lectures well, but he writes with his mouse which is eh. The only thing for marks is quizzes and final. However idea of seperating quizzes into parts is the dumbest idea, as it takes more time to upload than write. Also the textbook is useless, and its better to use the previous stats one

Derek seems optimal for in-person lectures. He is very knowledgeable and knows how to clearly explain concepts. He appears to dislike (and lacks the resources for) online learning - using a mouse to write notes, but that doesn't take much away from his ability to teach. Exams are fair, but lacks prep such as practice exams and questions.
Hands down the best professor in SFU. The reason that I am confident in working in a stats related job is because of him.
Excellent prof!

Dr. Bingham's stuff is very useful.It is easy because his notes are impeccable(try study the textbook then you'll know),however you have to be in class and fill the other half.TAs and Dr.Bingham are very accessible,make sure you ask if you have problems.Pay attention in class,do the assignments,understand his notes, then you will do well.
The best :))

Prof Bingham is a really good prof. U should try to take stat 270 with this prof. His lecture notes r really easy to understand and u should go to the class always to copy his notes. U need to study his lecture notes and so all the assignments to do well.He clarifies the tough material very nicely.I learnt alot from this class:)
One of the BEST Professors! Highly recommend him. Super-nice, super-helpful, super-clear. His exams consist of questions from the notes and practice exams. Do those, you'll ace the course!!

This prof in one word: Awesome. Explained concepts really well including difficult concepts like double integration. I was skeptical of the poster below when they said that they went from bombing the first MT to an A-. I did just that. Highly recommended. Wished he was my 152 professor. Would've actually learnt something in that class then.
Fantastic prof. Clear and straight forward. Wish I had him for calc too.
I strongly agree with the past two comments. Derek's friendly manner and grass root approach to statistics makes this course easier than it is considered to be.

I agree with the person below. He did an excellent job in teaching this course. Just go to lectures and you don't even need to study much and you can have a good grasp of the materials already. A highly recommended prof!

For a potentially hard course such as STAT270, Derek does a really great job in making it interesting and easy to learn. Assignments and tests are fairly easy (similar to samples and suggested problems).
good prof with a sense of humour. love his online notes and hints for midterm/exam. explain ideas in a clear way. highly recommended.
Good prof.  I liked the notes on web.  Hard assignments, but fair test and final.  Would like more than 1 mid-term.
organized lectures! His notes, examples, and hints in class were great! exams were fair~ A recommended prof! ^^  Too bad he never replies emails.
a good prof.

Nice person but a terrible professor. She herself seems so confused and lost in her lectures lol. people came to class only because of iclicker. If you take it with her, you will have to teach yourself basically. Though you have to go to class due to the iclicker questions, you won't learn anything. She has these annoying group activities too!

Nice, and accessible outside of class. She held office hours right after each lecture, and was very active online on Piazza. Her assignments were reasonable, and the exams relatively easy. Her actual lectures were not good. Too many bad iclicker questions, not enough meaningful practice problems and examples taught in class. Overall, not that bad.
Gives poor explanation. She doesnt explain anything in class and just throw some random clicker question. I feel like I teach myself om this course. People are just failing because of her
Do not take her.

Avoid at all costs. There was absolutely zero motivation for any theorem or concept which made it next to impossible to learn how to apply it. The course textbook and her teaching style are totally incompatible which makes the textbook a waste of time. She is completely unorganized and lectures are just "group activities" on concepts untaught.
really bad
awful
worst prof ever

Worst experience I have ever had. As mentioned before, it's all about self-studying because the lectures are not helpful at all. The textbook, although it is cheap, does not explain concepts well. I highly recommend you do not take a course with her. If you do, be sure to visit the workshops often.
The course it self is pretty tough, and her lectures weren't the greatest but she is very helpful if you go to her office hours.
Lectures are useless and you are paying money for self-studying, though you can see the teacher for help about the problems in the textbook.

probably the worst prof I have had so far. The course is already confusing enough, and she just makes it 5 times harder with her poor english, and poor notes. On top of that, there are no homework assignments, and the practice exams and solutions she gives are useless, as they hardly give any detail on how to get the final answer. Avoid this prof.

Bad lectures, not clear, exams are way to hard, way beyond what we learn in class. Textbook is not even useful, difficult to understand, has minimal solutions to questions, waste of money. Avoid this prof.

It's true that her English can't be compared to other instructors. But if you do PAY ATTENTION, it is understandable. If you have been to her office hours, you know that she is a very patient instructor and will spend more time than her office hours to teach you. The examples she used are from the course-notes, but are good examples, the same type
If you like to learn everything by yourself, plz take her course and you won't regret. Just pay attention to all the sample exams cz they are almost the same as real exams!!!!

Avoid at all cost!!! She can hardly speak english, she relies on this course-note package written by someone else, slides written by someone else, and when she writes her tests they are totally unrelated. Horrible teacher, horrible book, the only way to learn this class are from the TAs, and Khan academy.

prof is useless, classes are just sessions of her spewing words that don't make any sense. Doesn't go over many useful examples either. Midterms have almost no correlation with homework or examples in the useless textbook/lectures. AVOID AT ALL COST!

she cant teach. if she can teach anyone in the world can teach. useless textbook with exercises without answers( how the **** do we know if were doing the questions right or not) She doesnt really expain the examples in class. Even if she does i dont get what she is saying. AVOID HER AT ALL COST.

I took this course in spring. Harsha is a very chill and approachable professor. His explanations are clear and his expectations are reasonable. Manageable workload. Fair exams, though the final was a bit tricky. Practice assignment and textbook questions well to prepare for exams.

The best professor I could have wanted for STAT270. His lectures are clear and assignments are straightforward. Exams are also fair. He is super approachable and is always looking to help students. He is constantly seeking feedback to improve his course which is something I respect. He is very caring and wants to see his students do well. 10/10

Dr. Perera genuinely cares about students. He goes slowly during lectures and repeats important concepts. His office hours are quite helpful and he often mentions what type of questions will be on the exam during class. Still, it is a hard class so make sure to consistently practice outside of class. Take STAT 270 with him if you're able to!
switched from scott pai's section to this one and im so glad. prof perera can actually teach and responds extremely quickly to emails

He's really kind and is able to teach a really dense subject efficiently, he also teaches slowly in chapter three (probabilities) which is really nice of him, but 270 is pretty hard in general so make sure to practice the textbook questions he assigns. Overall he's great, you can tell he knows what he's doing :)
Nice

Created an account on rate my prof just for this.
We have our final tomorrow and we haven't even had the opportunity to view our midterms (average: 15/40). No sample finals are given, and he sets very difficult exams.
The book (he wrote) is pretty much useless but all assignments are from it.
Don't repeat my mistake and save yourself.

He really doesn't deserve the hate. STAT 270 online was incredibly straight forward: Read the text, watch the videos, do the practice questions. Assignments are short and simple, midterm was literally just questions from the textbook, and final although incredibly hard, is super curved. Got a 40% on it and still got an A-.
forced against my will to buy, read, and "learn" from his textbook. worst textbook in the world, poorly written and doesn't explain anything well. somehow i know less about stats after reading it.
Useless confusing textbook that is mandatory but makes absolutely no sense

He managed to completely automate his own course: Each week he had pre-recorded 10-minute videos working through a handful of problems, apart from that he was not involved in the course. I essentially had to teach myself all the material, using the textbook he wrote. By far the hardest and worst course I've ever taken. Avoid this professor.

He has an unprofessional attitude towards students and lacks compassion. He should never be in a position of authority because he lacks the ability to respectfully engage with students and empathize with their situation. I wish he was more student-oriented and honestly, human-oriented. Students are people too!

There are a number of factors that might leave him as the least professional and possibly worst teacher I have encountered at SFU so far. One being that he has been teaching for MANY years and appears to have made zero effort to learn how to use any of the tools provided for teaching.

Tim Swartz for STAT 270? Meh. He seems to be more concerned with getting the lecture material done as fast as he can and never pays attention to those who attend his class and have questions during his lectures. Exams are all from his textbook, 4 midterms, 12 marks each, 1 final, 52 marks (basically every mark you loose is worth 1% of final mark!)

Guys never take STAT270 online from this prof. I took this course online. On campus there is a 3 hour class every week but he will just give you 20 min. online videos a week. You have to do everything on your own. You also have to buy a textbook which is written by the same prof. but I will say don't buy that. Go for other books.

Wow this course is hard, no super hard should I say. I took online course, and material especially book and his video helped me a lot. Final is super hard, do not even think you can just pass the final then pass the course. Like he said, keep practising the questions from the book. You will be fine.

Great professor. He covers material very in-depth for the introductory course. He wrote his own textbook (which saves you a lot of money), and you can always ask him for advice. Highly recommend doing the questions that he has in his textbook.
Super super hard final exam like you had learned nothing in the previous 3 months when you see the questions with a super super useless textbook so, avoid him as possible as you could.

He is a nice guy, however sometime you will be confused by his questions if you are not a native English speaker. e.g obtain the prob that 2X exceeds Y by more than 4, you want P(2X-Y>4). Exam is super hard but you learn stuff through the process. Have an extra textbook ready and the first thing you want to do is correct the typos in his textbook

While taking this course I did not realize, but this course is really helpful, especially for Macm 201. I pretty much went through the notes, studied the textbook and like the prof said, I did a lot of questions from the back of the chapters. The TA was super helpful as well. I thought this was going to be a hard course but it wasn't as bad.
took his distance class not helpful at all...final worth 55% which covers everything but not that hard(except one or two).I got A
Took his stat270 distance, final is more important than midterm (55% for final grade)which covers everything but not hard to get A

Just so you know - if you take this course online Swartz will write the midterm and final but have nothing else to do with you. All questions will be answered and grading will be done by a grad student (who doesn't know what questions will be asked on tests). Swartz' book will only confuse you unless you get a decent book (like Devore). Good luck.
im taking his distance education course. no lie, this is a hard course and all, but the questions he gave on the midterm and the assignments were fair.
I like this prof, his midterms and final were quite easy  and I got an A for stat 270.All you need to do is to working out the   questions after each chapter.

Course itself is really interesting,Dr Swarts explains material clearly , its just that the course itself is a difficult course. Midterms were fair , although the avg was around 4-6/12 . Although I didnt ended up getting the best grade,however, I found this course to be useful in real life applications. Great proff overal., Useless TAs tho.
i don't know what's going on with distance ED, but i think he is a good prof, he gives hints during lecture about the coming midterms. but he said it's a difficult course, and it is.
Do not take the distance education class. I read the comments, and thought "oh I can handle it" No. You can't. Just save yourself the trouble and frustration. DO NOT TAKE. I MEAN IT. DONT DO IT.

Quite unfair when it comes to marking and scaling. Took a distant education course with him and regretted it. Not enough solved problems given. Exams are pretty difficult and he does not scale very much.

How can a prof like him still teaching in SFU? I don't think students would like to study stats anymore after taking his class. Exams are super difficult (avg 30-40%)~ and he treats Dis Ed students like nothing (zero help) His text book exercises are quite useless because there no answers, so you don't know you do them right or not.
I took BUEC232 before taking this course, but it still looks like OMGosh for me....If you read his textbook, you will find he made easy things complicated.......
If not the worst prof, definitely the top 5. Such a hypocrite with a cheesy sense of humour. The most useless prof I've ever encountered.
Wow! Just took the final and got destroyed. I really hope he keeps his word though. He mentioned that unless you get 30%, he wouldn't fail you. I'm praying!

He's very clear and slow at explaining things, and patient while answering questions. Quizzes are fair if you catch up with the lectures(lots of hints on quizzes!) and study the sample quizzes. Final is a bit harder but the marking scheme is not that terrible. Overall he's generous on the final grade. I got 67% and ended with an A.

This is a difficult course only because there are loads of material to cover. Pay attention and fully understand the problems covered in class and you will do well, since similar problems often appear on the midterms and exam.

I came into this class expecting a hardass, but he wasn't like any one of those comments described him to be. He's very approachable, funny, and obviously knows his stuff. Questions on mt's are really easy, some are right from his notes. Go to his class, because the stuff he talks about are quite useful on the mt's hint hint...
Hard but fun course. Useful material for real life - but meant for people with a math brain. If taking this for entrance req for business, take BUEC instead if you don't like mathematical concepts.
HOLY ****! I attended every lecture. Went to the workshop every week, I TRIED on this course. Grading scheme is tough! You either get it right or it's wrong. No partial marks = fail

Very hard course, especially with him its even harder. His midterms are fairly hard but still rather ok. His final is just out of this world! totally unexpected, and unless you REALLY know your stuff, you won't do well. Avoid taking his stat!

Very hard course.  Class average for every quiz was below 50%.  His notes are really hard to read because he just writes them out by hand puts scanned copies onto the course website.  I would not take a course with this instructor again.

how the hell are you above the class average before the final and end up with a C-. Idiot deceived us by telling us he was gonna scale it better relative to past terms. Quizzes are too hard and tricky. For the type of course that is it (bs) I put in enough effort and was thorougly screwed!
SIGH  JUST PASS    His queizs are too hard
hard

If you think you're failing, keep your head up.  Try as hard as you can, and you'll probably be surprised at your final grade. For cheat sheet, WRITE DOWN AS MANY PROBLEMS ON IT AS YOU CAN!!! Final will use problems you didn't think were important, but in a different way. Helped me tons!  I had below 50% going into final and came out with a B.

His tests are brutal, his notes suck. He writes with an overhead marker on paper and then photocopies it for us to download.  Barely legible when you print it.  His tests are way too hard because the questions are vague. the class average on every test is well below 50%.  I dont understand why they have to be so difficult!
No Comments

His lecture was well organized & logical  The quizzes are tricky but u can do them well by practising on old quizzes which are on his web site. However, he is not so care about his students. His Off.H was very little and he is not so patient w/ students who have Qs.

His quizzes and final exam can demonstrate how well you learn this course. Although his quizzes are tricky,you can overcome it throught practising the past quizzes posted on line. Also, he will give you a fair grade if you study well at the end.

His teaching is fine with helpful notes and clear clarifications in class. Quizzes are easier if you actually spend your time going to class and do practice quizzes which are always available online. Listen to his hints in class, and spend some time doing practice problems.
Shitwartz, it's not ur fault. Just that the whole school is kidding us.

I have no clue how I managed to pass this course.
 All I know is giving students killer hard material in an "intro" stats course doesn't help when you take higher-level courses.  You spend too much time worrying rather than learning!
the quizes are very tough and the final is easy. ignore the quizes if u did bad. he will just count 100% for the final.
bad guy

Run away if he's teaching~!! His quizes are tricky; they are design for two types of student: supersmart and genius; so, if you r super smart, you can past; but u can only get good mark if u r a genius.  Too many material in this class & he teach 2 fast!!
Although his lectures are through and have structure, they are too easy and his exams are impossible. Don't take his courses unless you plan to fail.
final is just way too hard!!!
No Comments
He's kind of bland, but goes over the material quite well, and is a nice guy.
his final is really hard. his quizzes are relatively easy.
beware of Tim Shady's marking SCHEMES
That's no point of studying his test, it's mission impossible !
He is very precise and clear, but the midterms and exams are hell!!!
Amazing if you are taking stats 270 take it with her
Overall it was awesome. You can study just a week to pass the course.

Sonja is an amazing professor. Exams was around the same difficulty as the examples in the lectures. As long as you understand those, you are golden. This class can be difficult, but Sonja made the course material easily understandable.
Stay awayy. Triple caution
He is not good at delivering information. He doesn't record his lectures nor posts complete notes, so if you miss a class, good luck.

scott is so funny, I actually liked going to lectures. he's not the best teacher, but his exams are easy if you do the assigned questions, + he lets you do a crib sheet for each exam. idk why everybody says he's mean??? he's just a silly guy fr. barely any hw, so majority is exams. my class also got a huge scale at the end (bc ppl were failing lol)

avoid at all costs, wait for better. terrible lecturer, and assigned a large assignment right finals. didn't follow the textbook, added a bunch of irrelevant unreasonable questions on the final. made the class 10x harder than it needed to be. very rude, actively shit talking his students and yelling. i don't respect him as a person nor as a prof.

I don't know if Scott thinks he's good at teaching. His lectures are disorganized and he explains concepts poorly.  He always acts like he taught certain concepts before even though he clearly didn't. I only go to lectures because he often puts his examples on his tests. I feel like ANY YouTube stat video I saw explained things better than Scott.

Took this class 2 years ago. One of the worst experiences I've had in SFU. Teaches super easy concepts during class and gives high level easy examples and expects us to figure things out (book has no solution key). Suspiciously started receiving emails from OneClass this semester even though I never used such services. Sussy prof.

I wish someone would have asked me: This is already a hard course, why would you make it even harder by taking it with Professor Pai? Don't make the same mistake I diddo not under any circumstance take a class with this professor. Even if his exams are fair, the only thing I'm left with after his lectures is agonizing confusion. Avoid him.

Literally DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. Impossible to follow lectures. Mic is terrible to say the least. Explanations during class are atrocious. Notes are literally of no use they look like someone's rough work (not to mention his shabby and illegible handwriting). His exams are hard, his grading harder yet. Absolutely avoid this class come what may.

While not useless, I found his lectures to somewhat unclear and not very helpful overall. Additionally, his audio and video quality were poor over Zoom making it harder to follow along and pay attention. I ended up relying a lot more on the textbook than usual. Luckily the class followed it very closely so I could review the content easily that way

Scott hardly gave any chance for students to get a good mark in his class since there was no homework that could be turned in for marks; the class was graded entirely on midterms and the final. He would often make us watch YouTube videos he recorded 5 years ago, some of which contained errors he has not bothered to fix. This was all before COVID

Final exam wasn't anything like he said it was going to be like or any of the previous exams were like. Instead of a dozen word problems, we were given 24 multiple choice questions with between 5 and 12 possible answers. There were at least 3 typos in the exam and questions went unanswered. Instead of the usual 3 hours for the exam, we only had 2.

Scott is a pretty funny guy and makes lectures somewhat entertaining. His explanations are not bad and with extra work, at home, you can work through the information and figure it out. We had 4 midterms and a final and it was a great distribution for grading and learning. He isn't the best professor I've had but not horrible.

"U don't come to my class, u gon' fail" "U don't use my lecture notes, u can't keep up" "Guessing is cheating b/c you pretendin u know something u don't" "U fall behind, u don't catch up" "WHY IT DON'T WORK? it don't work b/c it don't" "Watch my youtube video" "Make sure u come early" *Scott pullin up 5 mins late -your one and only, Scott Pai

This day, the day after the last day of class, a stat holiday, Good Friday, Scott decides to have a Zoom meeting. A 2 hr Zoom meeting. Why? Extra help? More examples? No. To discuss the final exam. For 2 hours. Exam information is only provided though this meeting. No emails or canvas notifications. Just take BUS 232 if this is for a requirment.

Scott has absolutely not reacted to the current virus situation at all. He posts zero online lectures and let us watch his youtube vids 3 years ago which he is basically reading slides and makes no sense. Worst prof in my life.

The course was hard. You need to put in hours, understanding the theory and doing the problems. Solving the entire textbook. Due to its difficulty for a 200 level course one would have a tendency to put the blame on the professor. He was decent in my opinion, lectures are clear and to the point, he tells you what to expect (posts sample tests).
Class average is only C... If you work with another prof, class average is B-

Scott teaching habits: -Lates for class -Tells us to bring another prof's notes, but barely uses them -Uses 1 example or anecdote and repeats again & again -Occasionally says "HELLO!" to make sure you are listening -Makes us read his "reading assignment" which are poorly filmed YouTube videos -Goes overtime to teach new and important content

I am majoring in Comp Science so STAT 270 was one of the mandatory courses that I had to take. The course itself is the worst course I have ever had. And Scott himself is no better than the course. The average for 3rd midterm was 47% and he literally said "If u guys fail, I won't have sympathy for u". Don't waste ur time and money.

Do not at any cost take this course. No matter how hard working you are it will and i repeat IT WILL CRUSH you. He first off, never make it to class on time, extend the class cause of his lateness, does not offer decent office hours that correlate with the difficulty of his class, does not explain. His exam are was to long and impossible to finish!

All the negative reviews are really accurate, just please do not take a class with him AT ALL COSTS, just try waiting for a semester where a decent prof is teaching this course. SCOTT PAI IS THE WORST PROF EVER, he deserves a 0/5 rather than a 2.9 on here.
He thinks he is very nice. um.... avoid him

friendly reminder: for CS major, STAT 270 or Bus 232 is only prerequisite of CMPT 353, for data science major, u may take STAT 203, for statistics major, u may take STAT 270 in the summer 2020 because the offering of STAT 285 will not be in the summer. for ur GPA trust me, any lecturer is better than him. Online STAT 270 is also nice, if you follow

WORST prof I have EVER met in my LIFE!!! Exam is so hard and time consuming that you won't be able to finish it. The exam is WAAAAAAAY harder than other profs. If you are not a genius in STAT, then avoid him at ALL COST! Save your money and spend it on more meaningful things.
This class is a waking nightmare, and if you really REALLY think you should take it, you might just be more braindead than a coma patient.
Awful and very rude. The more effort you make, the more frustrating you will be. Midterm is extremely long and hard and not possible to finish.
this guy sucks! misses stuff that the course is suppose to offer, and he attitude stinks!

Scott makes this class extremely frustrating. More often than not, he will rush through important topics, leaving us on our own. He almost never comes to class on time, leaving us in lecture for longer than we should be. Despite his hints, exams are very lengthy and difficult, resulting in abysmal averages where up to 80% of the class will fail.

Actually, online stat 270 or bus 232 are very good choice in the semester. This man makes a 200 course become extremely hard and unclear. He doesnt know what the key points are in the course. AVOID this man! Dont ruin your life!

He can teach the concepts decently, but doesn't finish the content in class, skips almost half the material in lectures. The class has 4 midterms, with no review lectures. Terrible professor, you'd be better off taking this online and self-studying. Our last midterm had a 31.7% average.
Even if you have to take a semester off to avoid the course with him! Lectures are close to unhelpful, you need to learn a lot.
It was difficult to understand his accent. Easy class, bad lecturer. So he may have a bad rating, and he deserves it.

Do whatever can to avoid this one!!! The course opens every term! Dont take it with him!!! He isnt helping helping us either. He is literally cramming material up our brain. If you really want to ruin your life, you can try
His notes and tests are actually two different level.
I've never had such an unorganized terrible course. It feels like the objective isnt to learn but to frustrate the students. BTW AVG grade in the test is only 31.7%.
Excellent professor! MUST TAKE STAT course with him! Garunteed A+, free midterm marks. A lot of help from TA AND HIM. I am just kidding.
I do not understand that department of statistics has such instructor. In the test, you only can solve problems that appears in the lectures or sample. Avoid him at ALL COST!!!

This class has crushed my, and seemingly many others, hopes and dreams. The 3rd midterm just happened, and nobody was prepared. Material is poorly "taught" in class, and is heavily extrapolated on the 4 midterms. There is no review material provided, and the TA's don't help. Abandon all hope if you MUST take this course.

One of the worst prof's Ive had, just yells at the class because he has to teach things. His tests dont follow his notes and his notes dont even follow the notes he asks you to print off. Avoid at all costs.

He is a really bad prof, I have never encountered such a bad prof in my life, he will barely go over different types of questions from the given notes, and he will just say "do this yourself" and gives us an answer key that does not help at all as well. To top it off when you ask questions he gets mad (from my experience), not a very helpful prof.

The majority of the positive feedback seem to all be written by the same person with a rather poor command of english, imho it might be scott pai trying to boost his ratings. The class is crap, very difficult to follow along, and he'll be 3-4 lectures behind by the time the first midterm comes by. He DOES NOT respond to emails.

he said the midterm will be on chapter 5 but it was on chapter 6...... midterm 1 class average 12% (this tells you something)  midterm 2 class average 8%  uses other prof (Timothy Swart)'s Notes which he doesn't even know he understands, and does not go through the lecture in a order; its everywhere if u go or not u will not do well

Makes simple concepts very complicated. Very unclear teaching style, be prepared to do mostly self learning. He gives you 4 midterms, each with roughly 4 questions, that are worth %12...so bomb one question and say goodbye to %3 of your final grade... Would not recommend this prof.

Doesn't explain very clearly at all. Expects a lot of self-studying and always ends classes late with an expectation you will look at his online videos at home, which are equally confusing. Midterm 3 had an average mark of 3/12, which he considers "easy" compared to his final which is worth 52% of overall mark. Avoid this prof at all costs.

Tough course, uses cheap&thin textbook with less,unclear explanation. Always finish late; usually 5 min so if you have a class after, expect yourself to be late. boring lectures,(all i hear is what next)and every single day B4 he starts the class he blows the mike really loudly to get everyone's attention which is super distracting and annoying.
He is nice person except he gives you too many questions on assignment! A typical asian teacher =/ His notes are organized, but you have to attend the class. Final is hard, be well prepared!
Not one of the best profs, but not one of the worst profs either.

Lectures are worth going to, as the basics are covered very well. The hw will be much more difficult than the examples covered in class though. All exams were fair, but some written Q's require some real thinking. Sometimes he's late for class and doesn't hesitate to keep us in after class for a few extra minutes. Not a bad prof altogether though.

His teaching methods are definitely not for everybody. He always forces you to copy down notes 'after' he explains something, rather than 'while' which really annoys me. He's paid to teach, not dictate how we as students learn. His exams are tough. You really need to master the examples in class. The assigned homework is tough, but manageable.

Gives a lot of tough hwk questions (ie proof questions) and gives hard exams. The 2nd midterm avg was lower than the first one, a lot of T/F. His lectures are good but not enough to cover most of the hwk, he makes sures that important concepts are understood. Hwk and notes are good indicators for the exams. Cheat sheet was useless most of the time.
doesn't go through a lot of examples in class and never covers enough concept for homework
even if you go to class... he might not even cover the key concepts for hwk
there is one thing to say: .... "WHAT will you miss if yoo do na atten crass? WHAT? DA key concep!"
This prof is completely useless, his lectures rarely keep up with the homework and he speaks in questions like whose line is it anyways, I wanted a stats prof not improv.

1 time he said in class "I will not show u how to do the hard questions because I already know how to do them... u have to do the hard questions" HOW ARE WE SUPPOSE TO DO THEM WHEN YOU DON'T EVEN SHOW US HOW?! hwk completely different level from his lecture notes. MT1 avg was around 63 MT2 avg was 53. HAVE TO GO TO WORKSHOP IF U INSIST TO TAKE HIM!

very good hand writing and also his chinese accent made me comfortable (although not quite pleasant for me). lectures are highly recommended, and keep practising. His homeworks are quite much, but not pushy.Read books and notes care enough!

This guy was a decent prof who has a strong knowledge in statistics and probability.  I found his voice kinda annoying afterwhile but at least spoke loud enough.  Notes are not easy to follow as his writing sucks.  He had online notes which we had to print and fill out in class as well as other written examples, making our notes difficult to follow

I liked Scott (and his analogies - NBA player?) His assignments are long but helpful (just start early) - exam questions from the assignments and lecture notes! (I can't believe that people are complaining about stat 203. speechless....)

If you attend all of his class, copy all notes, you will get a good grade.  He cares about his students, if one don't understand what he say, it's just because he doesn't know stat~!! Read you book! .btw,he english is actually not too bad, u can surly understand all his word.
very hard

fair marker, care about students, and willing to help you out. His pop-quiz=giving you bonus! His English? I can understand it anyway. If you really understand his notes, the exams wont be that hard for you.
Boxin in pretty good. He gives you four really easy marks with the midterms, but study hard for the final.
If you don't have any friends study with you, don't skip because he did not post his notes on canvas.

Sometimes the accent is hard to understand, but great prof though. Goes through problems in class. Also there was 4 midterms (which I think is a good thing because a screw up on one midterm doesn't tank your grade).

Do & understand ALL the questions in textbook; theyre tougher than the midterms. Do his practice midterms, theyre similar to the actual. Final exam is tough; 1/3 of the questions were for the last 2 chapters of the book. Although you can self-learn from the text, attend lectures since he doesnt post notes, which have useful tips/tricks for exams
this course scared me at first, but once you understand the concept, very easy

Excellent prof with great explanations and lots of in class examples. Would highly recommend sitting in the front few rows due to his soft speaking voice. He has as a bit of accent but not hard to understand at all. Midterms are very fair but the final was somewhat difficult.
Good lecturer although he can be hard to understand at times. Tests are pretty straightforward. Dry sense of humour is awesome.

Boxin is a very fair professor. He's sometimes a little unclear in lecture because he's ESL and soft spoken, but mostly does a good job. Wish the course was a bit more organized (no notes or practice questions).
i am under the water, help me

Pulindu is a terrible prof. His slides contain numerous spelling mistakes and errors, leading to them making very little sense. His final exam contained many mistakes, to the point that he stopped us 2 hours in and had to clarify. He makes very little sense when explaining content and just reads the slides to you.
I believe they needed someone to teach the course and chose him at random. The number of typos in each class, and even two hours into the final?! Prepare to study by yourself. EXTREMELY HORRIBLE.
Avoid. At. Any. Cost. Worst prof, was a mistake to not drop the course after the first week.

Pulindu is not very talented in explaining materials. However, I do believe he is passionate about the math. The main issue is that the course is difficult, and giving lectures is hard. He is also a very new instructor. Still, the course itself is very difficult, so I don't blame him too much for not being able to teach it easily.

In many assignments and lectures, he had many errors needing clarification via announcements or assignment resubmissions. One of which was him not copy pasting a question from the textbook properly. In the final, he made a significant mistake which was clarified 2hr in, after many had left. He is not at the level of a university professor.

The worst prof ever to join SFU. Avoid at all costs. His final was tough af All of his questions made no sense and  exam literally had nothing related to what he taught in class, he expected the students to do everything. He skipped classes and did not take the seriously.

Pulindu spends most of the time in class reading off the slides. His accent makes the class really unengaging and boring. He doesn't assign any homework questions after lectures making it hard to understand concepts. It would be better if you just read the textbook instead.

Lecture was held in SFU's largest lecture room, but only a few students showed up. He missed many lectures, requiring other professor to step in and teach. He just reads PDF files (contains errors), and the exams randomly sourced from websites on Google. He is cared strike, he really doesn't care about the students and how his actions impact them.
Not the best. He isn't audible during the lectures. If you could study the material on your own, then go for it.

based on reviews i thought he be horrible but he isn't. his slides are better version of the textbook even tho there are typos. He is helpful out of class and always takes time after class to help. He also gives a lot of opportuntiy to ask questions during class. the problem is he is not an engaging lecturer. tests are fair and are the same to hw.

I genuinely don't think he is qualified to teach. Lecture slides have countless typos/mistakes, which is extremely distracting. Even after he uploads a new slide (which he does not tell students, so we don't know which slides are the latest), it still has some typos/mistakes. His excuses are always "Because I just copy-paste from the textbook".
Useless Prof. I got an A. The course was easy but he shouldn't teach

Im a good very good math student and this guy is terrible. He is barely audible during lectures. He doesn't prepare you for anything. But his test are difficult not because the subject is difficult, but because they are so poorly written and throws misdirectors in the tests like misnaming variables to throw you off. Avoid at all costs.
No teaching at all and hard exams. I would not call him an instructor, he is rather someone random who happens to be offering a course.

I was expecting decent support since this is an online class. However, weeks go by and the only material you get aside from the textbook is 1 to 3 Tim Swartz's short example videos. Sometimes we get poorly made slides that are worse than the textbook + "lecture video" that reads whatever is on the slides for 1 hour. These don't help with anything!

Pulindu shows no compassion for his students, with zero intent to interact with us. He does not respond to emails or messages on Canvas. We are marked almost entirely off one midterm and the final (40% each), so if you do poorly on one, you will get a bad grade. His lectures have an absurd amount of content that is not practical to learn.

Insley is good prof, but boring after the first couple of weeks. I ended up teaching most of the course to myself thru the text book. You can tell that his notes are from 20 years ago. Test overall I thought were straight forward and relatively easy if you study a little bit. And you get a cheat sheet for course.

I have to say that he is good professor, even though I got a F in his class. I took this class again with Tim Swartz, and this guy is even more horrible (don't take it with him). I must warn you, this is an EXTREMELY hard class, and if you slack and get behind you will fail, which is what happened to me. Good luck!@
Very well organized. But very boring...... Best try not to missed a class.

I was pleasantly surprised when I checked the final result. I was only getting avg. score overall b4 the final. and I ended up getting B+.  thogh I messed up other finals, this was what I was expecting. but thanks to him. What I can say abt this class is.. never ever give up. U don't know what you'll end up with. So.. take a challenge and good luck

Notes and lectures extremely clear & well organized. Lectures slowly and clear, but may be boring. Hwk have many Q's but MUCH easier compared to other math courses. MTs and Final are very fair, but Q's are more conceptual (Ex. Stat terms), so class avg is not high. MT2 and Final allow cheat sheets. I only don't like that he never responds to email.
I took 270 and 330 with him. He is totally fair and taught very clear. You think it is hard because you are a social science student.

Notes r neat n organized. HE SHOULD LEARN TO MAKE A COURSE SITE n post stuff online instd of makng us borrw sample exams frm the workshp and phtocpying thm ourselves. I did VERY well on my assigns, but bmbed the final fr sme reason...hav yet to c my marked final. Contrry to sme cmments here, the avges for his exams this year were NEAR FAIL.
Explains things to the death.  Very clear and helpful.  Give hints to proofs, which is what every math prof should do.  Assigns quite a bit of hw, but exams are straight forward and very fair.
He is a very good and experienced prof. His notes are clear and organized. Exams are fair if you take your time to do all the assignment.
TAke him if he is teaching any of the stat class. He is probably the easiest prof in the stat department. He is as good as you can get if you wanna get good grades.

I wonder why is he teaching in this department instead of the marketing department. His voice sounded like a advertisement. Course is easy, and the final is not that hard. Although I must say that the final is more application involved.
Lectures are really really slow. In other words, they're as clear as water. As long as you do the questions from the book, the exam isn't hard whatsoever.
He's kindof an irritating ****, but overall good.

I'm not sure what these other guys are saying about the exams... Dr. Insley teaches the material in a straightforward manner and the exams have no questions that are any harder than his inclass examples.
A instructor that give a very clear lecture.  His exams might be pretty tough; but as long as you know the concepts; you should have no problem at all.
Bad teaching attitude. Lower level academic. In his class, you can learn everything in high school textbook. In his exam, you will be burned. EASY lecture, homework, but hard and irrelated exam.

This prof openly laughed at anyone who came in for extra help and on occasion would tell students that if they required his assistance then they did not belong in University. His classes were rushed, his exams didn't correlate well to the homework.
No one has ever insulted my intelligence more. I think he thinks the people he's teaching are 5-year-olds.
cant teach, booooorrring, never take anything with him

exams r not easy, but he's a good teacher
What an idiot

His slides are way more helpful than the textbook, and he gives a lot of useful materials for exam prep

Richard gives the impression that he's a retiree who show's up to his lecture because he's bored and wants to yap about random things not too relevant to the course material. He does not explain any of the  the course concepts, he mentions them while yapping about random things.

His slides are a random mass dump of unorganized topics.

one of the most naturally funny profs I've had. Midterms are mostly fair but final was hard. Always there for office hours and never rushed me out. Goes through material slowly, gives lots of detailed examples but explanations aren't the best and writing is crap. records lectures + uploads in-class written notes. Pretty humble for an ivy league.

disengaged, often missing discussions and not responding. Though she claims to be strict, it's likely a cover for poor communication. Her materials are hard to follow, and students often turn to outside sources. She seems knowledgeable but lacks the passion or ability to teach effectively, making her class uninspiring and unsupportive.

Says that she gives you all the code needed for R Studio but when students posted questions asking about the code because they weren't sure how to use it she shut down the discussion board because she took it personally

The major questions on the final were only ever taught on a theoretical level before. So, many assumptions and improvisations had to be made which was confusing. Be prepared to devote lots and lots of time to study for this course with Rachel. Could have taught the course better by showing more a holistic overview of some statistical methods.

I don't know why she gets so many bad ratings. She's nice, seems to care about students succeeding, and very fair about marking. I think her lectures were reasonably good. I managed to learn everything only from them. The TAs were terrible at marking, so you had to appeal every single assignment, but that wasn't Rachel's fault.
If you want to do well in this course, you shouldn't take it with her. She is a good person, but "Not a good prof".

She is very passionate about statistics, but she doesn't have much teaching ability so lectures are somewhat useless. Lecture slides weren't the best too, although exams were extremely fair considering the course material. Assignments due at 5pm which was strange. Learned a lot so would recommend her for STAT270. Very active on canvas discussion.
Awful awful awful
Hard course. Made even harder by terrible instructor. And seems to be a common theme, but pretty snide emails. Avoid at all costs
Very condescending emails, total disregard to students. One of my most horrible experiences in SFU.
Sad I can't give 0 stars. Worst class I've ever taken, will never take STAT again
tough grader, terrible lecturer (super boring), condescending
Wack. This course will wreck your GPA
Don't. Take.
Rachel is very nice and helpful. Always quickly available to answer student questions and tests on material that is very related to the slides/what is taught in class.
Awful professor for an awful course. Watch lectures at 2x speed. If you're in CS, take BUS232 instead and save yourself the trouble. Oh, and thanks for the snide e-mails.

She can make mistakes sometimes like having questions that are too hard, but she will correct them like reducing the total amount of points on a midterm. She might also add questions to assignments but she'll give you an extra week. Her lecture notes are helpful and readable, and her exams are fairly straightforward. Review Calc 2 for integration.

My peers told me STAT 270 would be a cumbersome course. Fortunately, I had the exact opposite experience taking it with Professor Altman :). Her lectures are extremely helpful, and her exams & assignments are fair. Definitely the kindest and most helpful instructor for STAT 270!
She has a heavy accent so I found myself relying a lot on online resources to learn. Her exams were very reasonable though and she is very nice and approachable.
An amazing stats professor, you won't regret taking her.

Took it in 2023 Summer term. Exams are similar to Exercises assigned, and detailed solutions are provided. As long as you complete and understand her Exercises, you will get good grades for exams. Her quick respond to emails helps a lot with questions I came up with.

Probably my best math prof till date, on par with Jamie. Literally such an angel. super understanding with midterms and cares a lot about the students if you show interest in the course. Very well organized and amazing to work with. I'd love to take another course with her
Very strong accent, her point is never clear and leaves students puzzled, easy grader

Her lectures were paced well, but may have been quick for some. She made up for the speed with how helpful she was after lecture/during OH. Her exams were very fair and easy if you did all the assigned problems.
